Lazy RSA  (263 solves / 110 points)
=

Generating primes is too hard, but I did find a couple posted online!

File - [lazyrsa.txt](./lazyrsa.txt)

Author - bunny

Solution
=

Opening the file, we can see that the values of `n`, `e` and `ct` are given. We can also infer from the question description that the `n` given is a prime.

Now, we have everything to do our regular basic RSA attack except `p` and `q` which are the prime factors of `n`. We can get these factors from [this website](http://factordb.com/index.php?)

```
p = 
q = 
```

Now, we can just plug in our values in [this website](https://www.dcode.fr/rsa-cipher) and get the flag!

`squ1rrel{laziness_will_be_the_answer_eventually}`
